unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critically reflect upon the efficacy of learning resources and approaches to develop mathematical, scientific and technological skills and concepts
Explain the current research foundations of the mathematical, scientific, design and computational thinking of students
Articulate pedagogical principles for developing students' mathematical, scientific and computational thinking skills with reference to educational research and practice.
Interpret and explain key concepts/principles/approaches/developmental progressions in NSW syllabuses for mathematics, science and technology

enrolment_rules.description: 80cp including (EDST100 or EDST1000) and (EDST101 or EDST1010) and admission to (BABEd(Prim) or BA-PsychBEd(Prim))

assessments.assessment_title: Critique of learning resources and approaches and Science workshop activities via Zoom and critique
assessments.description: Students are to provide a critique of two learning resources and associated pedagogical approaches (one for mathematics and one for science and technology) and provide a rationale for the use of the resources supported by research addressed in the unit.

a) Explain to a public audience in a blog post how students effectively learn the concepts and processes in the NSW Mathematics K-6 syllabus by drawing upon mathematics education research and theory. The explanation should include key concepts from each strand and sub-strand and a reasoned argument for why particular pedagogical approaches and Working Mathematically processes are highlighted. b) Create a multimedia presentation that explains to parents the most effective ways for students to learn concepts and processes in the NSW Mathematics K-6 syllabus. Give examples of evidence-based practice drawn from research, including cognitive theorists. Students are to provide peer feedback to e-portfolio posts.

data.subject_search_title: EDST2110 - Principles of Maths, Science and Technology Education
data.description: This unit develops Teacher Education Students pedagogical content knowledge (PCK) and understanding of the aims of the NSW Mathematics K-6 and Science and Technology K-6 syllabi. Within the context of the Australian Curriculum-Mathematics; Science; and Digital and Design Technologies the unit focuses on the scope and depth of teaching and learning content and pedagogies. Teacher Education Students develop their numeracy and scientific literacy through the processes of Designing and Producing, Working Mathematically and Working Scientifically using relevant contexts including sustainability. A research-based approach supports Teacher Education Students understanding of primary students’ conceptual and developmental stages of learning and learning progressions.
